table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the sound, and not to any letter or glyph.
Dies bezieht sich auf den Laut, nicht den Buchstaben oder das Zeichen.
Namnet på ett ljud, inte en skriven bokstav eller glyf.
Ceci se réfère au son, pas à la lettre ou au glyphe.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word or a homophone appears to be a component of {lolSeHcha:n} and {'eDSeHcha:n}, which suggests that perhaps {cha:n:nolink} can mean "rockets" in some contexts, or used to in the past.

table.name: mem
table.column: در مورد اژدر ها ایستاده اید! [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This slang term derives from the similarity in the {Qotmagh Sep:n} dialect of {chab:n:1} to {cham:n}.
Этот сленговый термин происходит от подобного в {Qotmagh Sep:n} диалект от {chab:n:1} к {cham:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This literally means "new pie". This slang term derives from the similarity in the {Qotmagh Sep:n} dialect of {chab:n:1} to {cham:n}.
Это дословно означает "новый пирог". Этот сленговый термин происходит от подобного в {Qotmagh Sep:n} диалект от {chab:n:1} к {cham:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Wunsch, etwas das man sich wünscht
心願（期望或要求的東西）
quelque chose de désiré ou de demandé [AUTOTRANSLATED]
The expression "pie ({chab:n:1}) in the sky ({chal:n})" refers to something that one hopes for but is unlikely to happen.

table.name: mem
table.column: This was originally defined as "emergency" in {TKD:src}, and its meaning was then expanded to include "auxiliary, backup" in a vocabulary list first published in {veS QonoS:src} then reprinted in {HQ 1.3, Sep. 1992:src}. Note that a noun-noun construction containing {chach:n:nolink} might have a different meaning depending on whether {chach:n:nolink} is the first or second noun in the compound.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a Klingon unit of (radio) frequency, similar to the hertz (Hz). However, one {chaDvay':n:nolink} is not equivalent to one hertz.[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: This verb implies that the subject is holding the object, and then (either accidentally or on purpose) lets it fall. If a cat knocks a glass off a table, the proper verb to use would be {pummoH:v@@pum:v:2, -moH:v} instead.[2]

Tämä verbi implikoi, että subjekti pitää objektia kädessään ja sitten (vahingossa tai tahallaan) pudottaa sen. Jos kissa kaataa lasin pöydällä ja se putoaa maahan, verbi {pummoH:v@@pum:v:2, -moH:v} on sopivampi.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: آنها، آنها (قادر به استفاده از زبان) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
eles, elas (capazes de usar a linguagem)

table.name: mem
table.column: close female friend of a female
väninna, nära kvinnlig vän till en kvinna
一位女性的親密女性朋友 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

This word is used by one female in addressing another female who is a close friend. Use of this word in other contexts may be considered insulting or offensive. It is not uncommon for a Klingon mother to address her daughter as {chaj:n:nolink}, but not the other way around.

table.name: mem
table.column: In the novel {Sarek:src}, {chal:n:nolink} is also the name of a type of flower.

table.name: mem
table.column: This would be used, for example, to refer to a puddle on the ground and it was necessary to be clear that the puddle resulted from rain. Otherwise, the water would just be {bIQ:n} (perhaps with some modifier or other).
Damit könnte man das Wasser in einer Pfütze beschreiben, um deutlich zu machen, dass es nicht etwas anderes ist. Ansonsten ist es einfach nur {bIQ:n} (evtl. mit einem anderen Zusatz).

Это может быть использовано, к примеру, чтобы сослаться на лужу на земле и это было необходимо, чтобы пояснить, что лужа появилась из-за дождя. Тем не менее вода будет просто {bIQ:n} (возможно с каким-то модификатором).

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the atmospheric phenomenon.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: A planet in the Romulan Star Empire.
Планета в составе Ромуланской звёздной империи.
The fact that the name of this planet appears to be "inhabited sky" in Klingon (see {chal:n}, {toq:v}) seems to be a coincidence.

table.name: mem
table.column: For concrete pieces of technology as opposed to the abstract idea of technology, consider {luch:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: area eastward, area towards the east
منطقه به سمت شرق، منطقه به سمت شرق است [AUTOTRANSLATED]
область на восток, область на восток [AUTOTRANSLATED]
zone vers l'est, zone vers l'est [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This is in the direction of the sunrise.[1] It is 90 degrees on a Terran compass, if north is 0 and degrees are counted clockwise.
China is in the east (from the perspective of Europe or America).

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a kind of volcanic rock in intermediate composition between basalt and rhyolite.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is kept in a large {bal:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a regional word for {qettlhup:n}.
This parallels the fact that there are some regions in the English-speaking world where "ketchup" is called "catsup".

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the gemstone and not to the shape.[1] For the shape, see {meyrI':n}.
Dies bezieht sich auf den Edelstein, nicht die Form.[1] Für die Form, siehe {meyrI':n}.
"Diamonds Are a Girl's Best Friend" is a song by Carol Channing, made famous by Marilyn Monroe's performance in the film "Gentlemen Prefer Blondes."

table.name: mem
table.column: Possibly a reference to the gelatinous substance found by the Chang'e 4 lunar mission.

table.name: mem
table.column: Chang and Eng Bunker were a famous pair of Siamese twins.
▶ {tlhIngan chang'engvetlh:sen} ▶ {nISwI':sen:nolink}: {cha' chang'engmey (telDaq lujomlu', nItebHa' lubaHlu'):sen:nolink} "Disruptor - 2 pairs (Wing Mounted, Fire Linked)[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: Hitting someone with the back of the hand means to issue a challenge to a duel to the death (see {Hay':v} and {Hay'chu':v}). To hit someone for some other reason, such as enjoyment, use the fist ({ro':n}).[2]

Jemanden mit dem Handrücken zu schlagen bedeutet, ein Duell bis zum Tod herauszufordern (siehe {Hay':v} und {Hay'chu':v}). Um jemanden aus einem anderen Grund, z. B. zum Vergnügen, zu schlagen, verwendet man die Faust ({ro':n}).[2]
It's quite common for the backs of one's hands to become "chap"ped.

offiziell sein, überprüft, autorisiert, legitim sein
vara officiell, vara autentiserad, vara auktoriserad, vara legitim

table.column: There have been a number of conquerors named Charles. Also, "Charge!" is a common battle cry.

table.name: mem
table.column: This contains less liquid than found in what a Terran might identify as soup. It is served in a {maHpIn:n}, and eaten in a {Duq:n}.
The fact that this is eaten in a {Duq:n:nolink} may be a reference to the Marx Brothers film "Duck Soup".

table.name: mem
table.column: The slang meaning may be a reference to the Marx Brothers film "Duck Soup".

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is an exclamation made in response to a statement which the speaker thinks is foolish or stupid. (The exclamation {Dap!:sen:nolink} using the non-slang word {Dap:n} is also possible, though less likely.)
If the speaker is referring to something that's happened which is a stupid thing to have happened (but really did happen, so that it's not a nonsensical statement), {chatlh:sen:nolink} or {Dap:sen:nolink} would not be used. Instead, a version of the idiomatic expressions {ghaH vuv SuS neH:sen} or {Dogh; tIghla' rur:sen@@Dogh:v, tIghla':n, rur:v} might be heard: ▶ {vuvpu' SuS neH vay'!:sen:nolink} "That's stupid!", "someone wanted the wind to respect him/her" ▶ {vogh tIghla' tu'lu':sen:nolink} "there's a t'gla somewhere" ▶ {HIv tIghla'!:sen:nolink} "a/the t'gla attacks"

Dies ist ein Ausruf der als Antwort zu einer Aussage getätigt wird, von welcher der Sprecher glaubt, sie sei unsinnig oder dumm. (Der Ausruf {Dap!:sen:nolink} mit dem Standard-Wort {Dap:n} ist dafür auch geeignet, aber seltener.)
Falls der Sprecher auf ein unsinniges Ereignis deutet (und dieses auch wirklich vorgefallen ist), dann werden {chatlh:sen:nolink} und {Dap:sen:nolink} nicht benutzt. Stattdessen hört man hier häufig Abwandlungen der Redewendungen {ghaH vuv SuS neH:sen} und {Dogh; tIghla' rur:sen@@Dogh:v, tIghla':n, rur:v}: ▶ {vuvpu' SuS neH vay'!:sen:nolink} "Das ist doch bescheuert!", "Da wollte jemand, dass der Wind ihn/sie respektiert." ▶ {vogh tIghla' tu'lu':sen:nolink} "Da ist irgendwo ein T'gla." ▶ {HIv tIghla'!:sen:nolink} "Der/Ein T'gla greift an."

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: This refers to a mathematical relation in which each element of the domain is associated with exactly one element of the codomain.[1]
It is not known if this word can be used for other technical senses of the word "function" (e.g., in computer programming).

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {QaghwIj vIQIj 'e' yIchaw'neS.} "Permit me to explain my mistake, your honor."[2]
▶ {QaghwIj vIQIj 'e' yIchaw'neS.} "Разрешите мне объяснить свою ошибку ваша честь."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This word is used for a broader range of objects than the translation "permit" suggests. Kinds of {chaw':n:nolink} include {HIjmeH chaw':n}, {Huch chaw':n}, {leng chaw':n}, {lojmIt chaw':n:nolink}, {yer ghajwI' chaw':n}, and {'elmeH chaw':n}. Thus, {chaw':n:nolink} can also mean "ticket", "pass", or "license".
A {chaw':n:nolink} shows that you are officially or legally allowed to do or get or own something, whereas a {Qoyje':n} serves as proof or verification of some sort of achievement or accomplishment.[3]

Это слово используется для более широкого диапазона объектов, чем предпогалается. Виды {chaw':n:nolink} включают {HIjmeH chaw':n}, {Huch chaw':n}, {leng chaw':n}, {lojmIt chaw':n:nolink}, {yer ghajwI' chaw':n}, и {'elmeH chaw':n}. Таким образом, {chaw':n:nolink} также может означать "билет", "пропуск", или "лицензия(документ, разрешающий вести определенную деятельность)".
{chaw':n:nolink} показывает, что вам разрешено официально или на законных основаниях что-то делат или что-то получать, или чем-то владеть, в то время как {Qoyje':n} служит доказательством или подтверждением некоего вида достижения.[3]
This is missing from the K-E side of {TKD:src}.

table.column: The first ever line of Klingon spoken on-screen was {wIy cha':sen@@wIy:n:2, cha':v}, in {Star Trek I:src}.

▶ {wIy yIcha'!:sen} ▶ {tlhIngan Dujmey law'qu' SommeyDaq batlh cha'lu'.@@tlhIngan:n, Duj:n:1, -mey:n, law':v, -qu':v, Som:n, -mey:n, -Daq:n, batlh:adv, cha':v, -lu':v} "[It] has been emblazoned upon the hulls of countless Klingon Starships."[3]

▶ {wIy yIcha'!:sen} ▶ {tlhIngan Dujmey law'qu' SommeyDaq batlh cha'lu'.@@tlhIngan:n, Duj:n:1, -mey:n, law':v, -qu':v, Som:n, -mey:n, -Daq:n, batlh:adv, cha':v, -lu':v} "[Это] было начертано на обшивках бесчисленных Клингонских кораблей."[3]

table.name: mem
table.column:
When used alone, this means "forearm" (referring to the entire lower part of the arm), but when preceded by {'uS:n}, it means "lower part of the leg". (The front of the lower leg is the {reStav:n}.)
It's possible to say {DeS cha'neH:n@@DeS:n:1, cha'neH:n} for "forearm", but this would probably be used only in a context where one was talking about both the forearm and the lower leg and needed to distinguish them.[2; 3]
Pun: "forearms" sounds like "four arms", but there are only two ({cha':n:num}, {neH:adv}).

table.name: mem
table.column: a bird noted for its song
یک پرنده برای آهنگ خود اشاره کرد [AUTOTRANSLATED]
en slags fågel (känd för sin sång)
一隻以它的歌而聞名的鳥 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
um pássaro conhecido por sua música
un oiseau connu pour son chant [AUTOTRANSLATED]

The cuckoo is noted for its song, and roadrunners are two species of cuckoos which are also known as chaparral birds. This may also be a reference to Charlie Parker, an American Jazz musician known by the nickname "Yardbird", or "Bird" for short. Also, in Spanish, "parpar" is the sound made by a duck.

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {cha'puj tlhIlHal vISuch vIneH.:sen@@cha'puj:n, tlhIlHal:n, vI-:v, Such:v, vI-:v, neH:v} "I want to visit the dilithium mines."[2] ▶ {cha'puj vIngevmeH chaw' HInobneS.:sen@@cha'puj:n, vI-:v, ngev:v, -meH:v, chaw':n, HI-:v, nob:v, -neS:v} "Give me a permit to sell dilithium, your honor."[3] ▶ {yuQ SumDaq cha'puj law' Datu'.:sen@@yuQ:n, Sum:v, -Daq:n, cha'puj:n, law':v, Da-:v, tu':v} "Detect large sums of dilithium on nearby planet."[4]

▶ {cha'puj tlhIlHal vISuch vIneH.:sen@@cha'puj:n, tlhIlHal:n, vI-:v, Such:v, vI-:v, neH:v} "Я хочу посетить дилитиевые шахты."[2] ▶ {cha'puj vIngevmeH chaw' HInobneS.:sen@@cha'puj:n, vI-:v, ngev:v, -meH:v, chaw':n, HI-:v, nob:v, -neS:v} "Дайте мне разрешение продать Диллитий, ваша честь."[3] ▶ {yuQ SumDaq cha'puj law' Datu'.:sen@@yuQ:n, Sum:v, -Daq:n, cha'puj:n, law':v, Da-:v, tu':v} "Обнаружено большое количество дилития на ближайшей планете."[4]

table.name: mem
table.column: Crude dilithium crystal is called {Dom:n}.[1] Chrystalline dilithium is used as the reaction moderating element ({choH lISbogh Hap'e':n}) in a Klingon Bird of Prey.[2] The verb {chIm:v} is used for a drained dilithium crystal.[3]

▶ {cha'pujqutmey vIje' vIneHbej!:sen@@cha'pujqut:n, -mey:n, vI-:v, je':v:1, vI-:v, neH:v, -bej:v} "I definitely want to buy dilithium crystals!"[4] ▶ {cha'pujqutmey chIm lutamlu'.:sen@@cha'pujqut:n, -mey:n, chIm:v, lu-:v, tam:v:2, -lu':v} "Drained dilithium crystals are replaced."[3]

▶ {cha'pujqutmey vIje' vIneHbej!:sen@@cha'pujqut:n, -mey:n, vI-:v, je':v:1, vI-:v, neH:v, -bej:v} "Я определённо хочу купить кристаллы дилития!"[4] ▶ {cha'pujqutmey chIm lutamlu'.:sen@@cha'pujqut:n, -mey:n, chIm:v, lu-:v, tam:v:2, -lu':v} "Дренированные кристаллы дилития перемещены."[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is considered singular (that is, several pairs of tweezers are {cha''etlh DaSwI'mey:n@@cha''etlh DaSwI':n, -mey:n}). The word was formed by analogy to {cha''etlh pe'wI':n} "scissors," with {DaS:v} "pinch" replacing {pe':v} "cut".

Dies wird als Singular betrachtet (d.h. mehrere Pinzettenpaare sind {cha''etlh DaSwI'mey:n@@cha''etlh DaSwI':n, -mey:n}). Das Wort wurde in Analogie zu {cha''etlh pe'wI':n} "Schere" gebildet, wobei {DaS:v} "kneifen" {pe':v} "schneiden" ersetzte.

table.name: mem
table.column: Note that this word is singular, unlike the English word "scissors".

table.name: mem
table.column: This literally means "we hit two targets". Note that {DoSmey:n:nolink} must be used, not the inherently plural {ray':n}. This idiom can be shortened to just {DoSmey DIqIp.:sen:nolink}

table.name: mem
table.column: This idiomatic expression means that two people are involved in a single activity and no one else is. For example, a duel may be described by saying {Suv cha' qabDu':sen:nolink} "Two faces are fighting", "Two people are fighting one-on-one".
one on one, one-on-one, face to face, face-to-face

единица веса, масса (около 5 фунтов или 2,25 кг) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
重量單位、質量（約5磅或2.25千克） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
unidade de peso, massa (aprox. 5 lbs ou 2,25 kg)

Since gravity on Kronos is different than that on Earth, it's not really clear what the exact value of this unit is, or whether it measures weight or mass. The original message in which this unit appears refers to it as a unit of weight "around five pounds (2.25 kg or so)".[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: According to the {BoP:src} poster, 8.7KT = 375 000 {cheb'a':n:nolink}. It is likely that one {cheb'a':n:nolink} is equal to nine {cheb:n:nolink}.[1]
Dr. Okrand said that "most units of measure" had forms with {-'a':n} added to mean 9 times, but did not explicitly say that this applied to {cheb:n:nolink}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: быть пьяным, быть одурманенным, страдать от интоксикации

table.name: mem
table.column: An alcoholic beverage best served heated and steaming.[1] Its name appears to be composed of {chech:v} and {tlhutlh:v}.[2]
Алкогольный напиток, который лучше всего подавать нагретым и дымящимся.[1] Это имя составлено из {chech:v} и {tlhutlh:v}.[2]
In the K-E side, this is given as "baceh'tluth". This is commonly assumed to be a typo, or perhaps a joke.

table.name: mem
table.column: The object is the place to which the subject returns (if it is not mentioned, the verb takes a prefix indicating no object). If the return is forced, use {tatlh'egh:v} instead.[2]

Объектом является место, куда субъект возвращается (если оно не упомянуто, глагол принимает префикс, который не указывает на объект). Если возвращение вынужденное, используйте {tatlh'egh:v} вместо этого.[2]

This was defined as just "return" in {TKD:src} and also glossed the same way in the body of {KGT:src}. The definition "return (to)" was added to the KLI new words list to distinguish it from {tatlh:v} when the latter was revealed.[2]

▶ {ghorgh pa'wIjDaq jIchegh?:sen} ▶ {wa'leS jIchegh.} "Tomorrow I will return."[3] ▶ {DaH machegh.:sen}[4]
The following four examples illustrate the role of the object(s) and how to use {chegh:v:nolink} with {-Daq:n} and {-vo':n}[2]: ▶ {lupDujHomDaq jIchegh.:sen:nolink} "I return on the shuttle." ▶ {lupDujHom vIchegh.:sen:nolink} "I return to the shuttle." ▶ {lupDujHomDaq may'Duj vIchegh.:sen:nolink} "I return to the battle cruiser on the shuttle" ▶ {tera'vo' Qo'noS vIchegh.:sen:nolink} "I return to Kronos from Earth"

▶ {ghorgh pa'wIjDaq jIchegh?:sen} ▶ {wa'leS jIchegh.} "Завтра я вернусь."[3] ▶ {DaH machegh.:sen}[4]
Следующие 4 примеры иллюстрируют роль объекта(ов) и как использовать {chegh:v:nolink} с {-Daq:n} и {-vo':n}[2]: ▶ {lupDujHomDaq jIchegh.:sen:nolink} "Я возвращаюсь на шаттле." ▶ {lupDujHom vIchegh.:sen:nolink} "Я возвращаюсь на шаттл." ▶ {lupDujHomDaq may'Duj vIchegh.:sen:nolink} "Я возвращаюсь на боевой крейсер на шаттле" ▶ {tera'vo' Qo'noS vIchegh.:sen:nolink} "Я возвращаюсь на Кронос с Земли"

table.name: mem
table.column: se tornar um apóstata, mudar para o lado do inimigo

table.name: mem
table.column: Klingons have two livers.[1, p.28] (See also {bIraqlul:n}.)

table.name: mem
table.column: For the mathematical operation of addition, see {boq:v:2}.

The example Klingon sentence was not written by Marc Okrand, but by an unknown staffer at Decipher. Only the Klingon sentence was published in the {HolQeD:src} article. The English translation comes from the card deck's rulebook.

▶ {DuHIvchugh ghol vaj qaStaHvIS may'vetlh HoSDaq ghob luchel quv ghajbogh tlhInganpu'lI'. (vI'be'.):sen@@Du-:v, HIv:v, -chugh:v, ghol:n, vaj:adv, qaS:v, -taH:v, -vIS:v, may':n, -vetlh:n, HoS:n:1, -Daq:n, ghob:n, lu-:v, chel:v, quv:n, ghaj:v, -bogh:v, tlhIngan:n, -pu':n, -lI':n, vI':v, -be':v} "If an opponent attacks you, during that battle your Klingons with Honor add INTEGRITY to STRENGTH. (Not cumulative.)"[2]
[1] {TKD:src}, [2] {Star Trek Customizable Card Game - Fajo Collection:src} (reprinted in {HQ 9.4, p.16, Dec. 2000:src})

table.name: mem
table.column:
In {TKDA:src}, {peQ chem:n:nolink} actually appears as two words (with a space). The space has been removed here with MO's approval.
The existence of {chem:n:nolink} as an independent word was hypothesized for a long time, and was only confirmed at {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2024:src}.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: faire une farce (à), jouer un tour (à)
The victim of the prank is the object.
Das Opfer des Streichs ist das Objekt.
The object was confirmed during the Q & A session.

table.name: mem
table.column: Klingon women make sounds like a {chemvaH:n:nolink} to indicate interest in a potential mate.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: bygga upp, bildas, formas, ta form, anta skepnad
This verb is also used to indicate the result of mathematical operations.[2]
Этот глагол также используется, чтобы указать на результат математических операций.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the verb {chen:v} with the suffix {-moH:v}, so verb suffixes of types 1 to 3 need to go before {-moH:v}, which is type 4.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {tlhIngan juHqo'Daq tlhIng yoSDaq 'oH toQDuj chenmoHlu'meH Daq wa'DIch'e':sen@@tlhIngan:n, juHqo':n, -Daq:n, tlhIng yoS:n, -Daq:n, 'oH:n, toQDuj:n, chenmoHlu'meH Daq:n, wa'DIch:n, -'e':n} "1st Construction Site: The Kling District, Klingon Home World"

table.name: mem
table.column: It's possible to be more specific, using, for example, {ra'Duch:n} "triangle" or {wej war(mey):n@@wej:n, war:n, -mey:n} "three columns" instead of the more general {tu'qom:n}.[1]
▶ {tlhaj negh; chen tu'qom.:sen@@tlhaj:v, negh:n, chen:v, tu'qom:n} "The soldiers march in formation."[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This literally means "the square malforms" (or something like that).[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: General Chang ({cheng Sa':n:name,nolink}) served under Chancellor Gorkon (see {ghorqon:n:name}), and betrayed him when he tried to make peace with the Federation.

table.name: mem
table.column: This verb is not used for plant growth.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: (tuulesta) pyöriä voimakkaasti kuin tornado tai trombi

Note that this is a verb in Klingon. In Klingon, one says "it tornadoes", similar to how one says "it rains" in English.
The verb {ver:v:1} can also be used to talk about tornadoes and whirlwinds.
Das Verb {ver:v:1} kann auch benutzen werden um über Tornados und Wirbelstürme zu sprechen.

Заметьте, что в клингонском языке это глагол. В клингонском языке сказать, что "идет торнадо", очень похоже на то, как кто-то говорит "идет дождь" на английском.
Глагол {ver:v:1} также может быть использован, чтобы говорить о торнадо и вихрях.

Observe que este é um verbo em Klingon. Em Klingon, diz-se "está tornado", semelhante a como se diz "esta chovendo" em inglês.
O verbo {ver:v:1} também pode ser usado para falar sobre tornados e redemoinhos.

table.name: mem
table.column: cheqotlhchugh maHaghbe''a'? cheDuQchugh mareghbe''a'? cheQIHchugh manoDbe''a'?
Tickle us, do we not laugh? Prick us, do we not bleed? Wrong us, shall we not seek revenge?
Wenn ihr uns kitzelt, lachen wir nicht? Wenn ihr uns stecht, bluten wir nicht? Wenn ihr uns beleidigt, sollen wir uns nicht rächen?
ما را ببند، آیا ما نمی خندیم؟ ما را ببند، آیا خونریزی نمی کنیم؟ آیا ما نمی خواهیم انتقام بگیریم؟ [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Skrattar inte vi om ni kittlar oss? Blöder inte vi om ni sticker oss? Skulle inte vi hämnas om ni kränker oss?
Щекотать нас, мы не смеемся? Укол нас, мы не истекаем кровью? Неправда ли нам, не будем ли мы искать мести? [AUTOTRANSLATED]
癢癢我們、我們不笑嗎？刺破我們、我們不流血嗎？我們錯了、我們不應該報復嗎？ [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Agrade-nos, não rimos? Nos picou, não sangramos? Errado nós, não devemos procurar vingança?
Jos kutitat meitä, emmekö me naura? Jos pistät meitä, emmekö me vuoda verta? Jos teet vääryyttä meille, emmekö me kostaisi?
Si vous nous chatouillez, ne rions-nous pas ? Si vous nous piquez, ne saignons-nous pas ? Si vous nous bafouez, ne nous vengerons-nous pas ?
This is a paraphrase of a famous passage from Shakespeare's {The Merchant of Venice:src}, Act III, scene i.

table.name: mem
table.column: perustaa, pystyttää, luoda, laatia, päättää, vakiinnuttaa (päätös, politiikka tms.)
This word sounds like "chair", but {che':v} is closer in meaning to "chair".
[1] {TKD:src}, [2] {SkyBox S25:src} (reprinted in {HQ 5.3, p.15, Sep. 1996:src}), [3] {SkyBox S33:src} (reprinted in {HQ 6.2, p.9, Jun. 1997:src}), [4] {paq'batlh 2ed p.138-139:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the native name for a plant cultivated by Klingons for its taste and aroma.
Dies ist der örtliche Name für eine Pflanze, welche die Klingonen für ihren Geschmack und Aroma züchten.
"Certs" was a popular brand of breath mints.

table.name: mem
table.column: type of animal, rabbit (Klingon animal with long ears)
type d'animal, lapin (animal klingon aux longues oreilles)
This is an animal with long ears, similar to an Earth rabbit.
Dies ist ein Tier mit langen Ohren, ähnlich einem Erdkaninchen.

table.name: mem
table.column: The "Chesterfield" coat is a type of overcoat.

table.name: mem
table.column: In the dialect of {voSpegh Sep:n}, this refers to any coat or jacket (what other Klingons would call a {wep:n:1}).
Im Dialekt von {voSpegh Sep:n} bezieht sich dies auf jeden Mantel oder jede Jacke (was andere Klingonen als {wep:n:1} bezeichnen würden).
The "Chesterfield" coat is a type of overcoat.

table.name: mem
table.column:
There is an idiom, {lo'laHbe'; chetvI' chIm rur@@lo'laHbe':v, chetvI':n:1, chIm:v, rur:v}.
The distinction between a {chetvI':n:nolink} and a {DuS:n} has to do with how the projectile is loaded.[2]

Есть идиома, {lo'laHbe'; chetvI' chIm rur@@lo'laHbe':v, chetvI':n:1, chIm:v, rur:v}.
Различие между {chetvI':n:nolink} и {DuS:n} делается в связи с тем, как снаряд был загружен.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a stick with a hook at the end, which is used as an aid in throwing (see {wob:v}) a {tlhevjaQ:n}.
This item, as described in {KGT:src}, would seem to be an "atlatl".

table.name: mem
table.column:
Separate the wheat from the "chaff".
Reverse of {vech:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: دیوار حائل (به عنوان مثال دیوار برلین) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
muro territorial (por exemplo, muro de Berlim)
mur territorial (par exemple, mur de Berlin)

table.name: mem
table.column: Backwards of "t-h", which is written using the letter "thorn" in Old English.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a squid-like Klingon creature.
Possibly just a coincidence, but "The Prussian Octopus", a famous poster from WWI, was published by H. & C. Graham Ltd.

table.name: mem
table.column: regera, styra, härska, leda, presidera, sitta ordförande

This almost sounds like "chair".
This word is defined in {TKD:src} as "rule, reign, run" and additionally in {KGT:src} as "preside".

▶ {juHqo'Daq vaS'a' tu'lu'. ngoch luchermeH 'ej wo' San luwuqmeH pa' ghom tlhIngan yejquv DevwI'pu'. DaH che' ghawran. yejquv DevwI' moj ghawran 'e' wuqta' cho' 'oDwI' Dapu'bogh janluq pIqarD HoD.:sen:nolink} "On the Homeworld, there is a great hall where the leaders of the Klingon High Council meet to determine policy and decide upon the fate of the Empire. Gowron currently presides, named leader of the High Council by Captain Jean-Luc Picard, who was acting as Arbiter of Succession."[3]

▶ {juHqo'Daq vaS'a' tu'lu'. ngoch luchermeH 'ej wo' San luwuqmeH pa' ghom tlhIngan yejquv DevwI'pu'. DaH che' ghawran. yejquv DevwI' moj ghawran 'e' wuqta' cho' 'oDwI' Dapu'bogh janluq pIqarD HoD.:sen:nolink} "В родном мире, есть великий зал, где лидеры Клингонского высшего совета встречаются, чтобы определить политику, задать курс и решить судьбу империи. Сейчас председательствует Гаурон, лидер Высшего совета, назначенный капитаном Жаном-Люком Пикардом, который был Арбитром посвящения."[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: "Cheron" was the name of the planet in {TOS - Let That Be Your Last Battlefield:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: 血 (ち) "chi" is a Japanese word meaning "blood".

table.name: mem
table.column: einen Vorteil haben (gegenüber etwas/jemandem), von Vorteil sein

One could say {chIb SuvwI':sen@@chIb:v, SuvwI':n} "The warrior is advantaged"/"The warrior has an advantage", but not {SuvwI' chIb:n@@SuvwI':n, chIb:v} (i.e., {chIb:v:nolink} cannot be used adjectivally).[1]
Backwards reference to an English slang expression for having an advantage over someone.

table.name: mem
table.column: The expression {Dujmey law' chIjpu':sen:idiom} means that somebody is experienced.
Выражение {Dujmey law' chIjpu':sen:idiom} означает, что кто-то являтся опытным.

table.name: mem
table.column: This normally refers to a being, but could refer to a device in a usage like {tem chIjwI':n}, in which case it takes the general plural suffix.

table.name: mem
table.column: lose, misplace, be unable to find, lose track of
از دست دادن، اشتباه، قادر به پیدا کردن، از دست دادن مسیر [AUTOTRANSLATED]
терять, положить не на место, невозможно отыскать, потреять чей-то след
失敗、錯位、無法找到、失去踪跡 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
perder, extraviar, não conseguir encontrar, perder o controle
perdre, égarer, être incapable de trouver, perdre la trace de

The idiomatic expression {DoS chIl:sen:idiom} means "to digress", e.g., {DoS vIchIl:sen:nolink} means "I digress".[2]
This verb can be used for misplacing your keys, but also for things like losing the signal of something you've been tracking.[3]

Идиоматическое выражение {DoS chIl:sen:idiom} означает "отклоняться", например, {DoS vIchIl:sen:nolink} означает "Я отклонился".[2]
Этот глагол может быть использован для описания потери ваших ключей, но также для вещей, подобных потери сигнала чего-то, что вы отслеживали.[3]
This was defined in {TKDA:src} as "lose, misplace". The other definitions were added at {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2017:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: be empty, be deserted, be uninhabited
leer sein, verwüstet sein, unbewohnt sein
vara tom, vara övergiven, vara obebodd, vara förbrukad, vara
Быть пустым, быть опустевшим, быть необитаемым
être vide, être désert, être inhabité, être abandonné
The verb {chIm:v:nolink} is used for a drained dilithium crystal.
Глагол {chIm:v:nolink} используется для опустевшего дилитиевого кристалла.
▶ {cha'pujqutmey chIm lutamlu'.:sen@@cha'pujqut:n, -mey:n, chIm:v, lu-:v, tam:v:2, -lu':v} "Drained dilithium crystals are replaced."[2]
▶ {cha'pujqutmey chIm lutamlu'.:sen@@cha'pujqut:n, -mey:n, chIm:v, lu-:v, tam:v:2, -lu':v} "Дренированные кристаллы дилития перемещены."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: برش دادن، تر و تمیز کردن (مو) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This word can be used to cut or trim other things, like grass, fringes on clothing, fingernails, etc.[2]
Tämä sana viittaa hiusten, kynsien, vaatteiden hapsujen, ruohon, tms. leikkaamiseen.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: Why did the "chick"en cross the road?

table.name: mem
table.column: total dishonor, absolute lack of honor
بی احترامی کامل، کمبود مطلق افتخار [AUTOTRANSLATED]
fullständig vanära, total brist på ära
desonra total, absoluta falta de honra

The first part of the example sentence was a lip-match for {mughojmoH parmaqqaywI':sen@@mu-:v, ghojmoH:v, parmaqqay:n, -wI':n}. The second part was a lip-match for {'ej jIHvo' nIHDI' jIbup:sen@@'ej:conj, jIH:n:1h, -vo':n, nIH:v, -DI':v, jI-:v, bup:v}.

▶ {potlhmo' batlh, vIqawba', 'ej chIvo' neH chIw vum'e'.@@potlh:v, -mo':v, batlh:n, vI-:v, qaw:v, -ba':v, 'ej:conj, chIvo':n, neH:adv, chIw:v, vum:n, -'e':n} "Because you care about honor. And this man has none."[2]

▶ {potlhmo' batlh, vIqawba', 'ej chIvo' neH chIw vum'e'.@@potlh:v, -mo':v, batlh:n, vI-:v, qaw:v, -ba':v, 'ej:conj, chIvo':n, neH:adv, chIw:v, vum:n, -'e':n} "Потому что ты заботишься о чести. А этот человек нет."[2]
total dishonour, absolute lack of honour

table.column: بیان، تجسم، بیرون آوردن، تجسم کردن [AUTOTRANSLATED]
表達、體現、散發、集中體現 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ilmaista, ilmentää, esittää, olla jonkin ruumiillistuma
incarner, représenter, être le parfait exemple de

table.name: mem
table.column: stairway leading to a door of a ship, gangplank
Stufen zum Eingang eines Raumschiffs; Laufsteg, Steg
راه پله ای که به درب کشتی منتهی می شود [AUTOTRANSLATED]
лестница, ведущая к двери корабля, трап [AUTOTRANSLATED]
escada que leva a uma porta de um navio, prancha
escalier menant à la porte d'un vaisseau, passerelle

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the projecting architectural structure that houses an entrance to a building. This is sometimes {qach choghvat:n:nolink} and sometimes {choghvat pa':n:nolink}. This word (which is really the word for "gangplank", see {choghvat:n:1}) is used for this part of a structure even if there are no stairs or ramps involved.

Dies bezieht sich auf die vorspringende architektonische Struktur, die einen Eingang zu einem Gebäude beherbergt. Dies wird manchmal {qach choghvat:n:nolink} und manchmal {choghvat pa':n:nolink} genannt. Dieses Wort (was eigentlich das Wort für "Laufplanke" ist, siehe {choghvat:n:1}) wird für diesen Teil einer Struktur verwendet, auch wenn keine Treppen oder Rampen beteiligt sind.

Avser en utstickande del framför en ingång till en byggnad. Kan ibland beskrivas som {qach choghvat:n:nolink} och ibland som {choghvat pa':n:nolink}. Ordet (som är samma ord som det för "landgång", se {choghvat:n:1}) används även om farstubron har varken trappor eller ramper.
It was clarified during the Q & A session that this has to be attached to the building.

table.name: mem
table.column: This was used to translate "update" (change the value of a variable) in Klingon Blockly.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This can also refer to a chemical or nuclear reaction.
Это может также относиться к химической или ядерной реакции.

table.name: mem
table.column: This appears on the {BoP:src} poster in the specification: {choH lISbogh Hap'e':sen:nolink}: {cha'pujqut:sen:nolink} "Reaction Moderating Element - Crystalline Dilithium".

table.name: mem
table.column: This is limited to physical activities, such as lifting weights or running.[1]

This was incorrectly defined as "train, coach", when it seems it actually means "receive training/coaching (in)", where the object is the sport, but this isn't clear at the moment.
Reverse of {joch:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: close in, get closer, come nearer
نزدیک شدن، نزدیک شدن، نزدیکتر شو [AUTOTRANSLATED]
The object of this verb is the thing the subject is getting closer to. {-Daq:n:suff} is not needed. It's sometimes used, but it's redundant (though not wrong).[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: chose tenant une queue de cheval
It is unknown why this word appears to combine {chol:v} and {jaH:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column:
Maltz was wrong earlier and there is a Klingon bow-and-arrow type weapon used in the past, in addition to modern bows and arrows borrowed from or modeled on those of other cultures. This word refers to a traditional form of arrow.[1]
This was defined only as "arrow", with an explanation. The annotation "(weapon)" was added for clarity.

table.name: mem
table.column: In a Klingon bar, the bartender shouts {'eb Qav:n} for "last call".[2]
В Клингонском баре, бармен кричит {'eb Qav:n} для "последнего заказа".[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: In typography, an "italics" font may be described as {chongHa':v@@chong:v:1, -Ha':v}. See {ngutlh tu'qom:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: be profound, be thorough, be careful, be good, be excellent
gründlich sein, sorgfältig sein, vorsichtig sein; gut sein, ausgezeichnet sein
عمیق باشید، کامل باشید، مراقب باشید خوب بودن، عالی بودن [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara grundlig, vara ordentlig, vara omsorgsfull, vara noggrann
будь глубоким, будь тщательным, будь осторожен; будь хорошим, будь превосходным [AUTOTRANSLATED]
要深刻、要徹底、要小心;要善良、要善良 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ser profundo, ser cuidadoso, ter cuidado; ser bom, ser excelente
olla perusteellinen, olla huolellinen; olla hyvä, olla erinomainen
être profond, être minutieux, être prudent, être bon, être excellent
This word is applied to a person's intellect, and expresses a meaning equivalent to {Qubchu'}. It is also used by itself as an expression of approval, similar to {maj:excl}.[1, p.148]

This is given two separate sets of definitions "be profound, be thorough, be careful" and "be good, be excellent", which have been combined.
Cantonese Chinese for "clever" (聰).

table.name: mem
table.column:
This word can also denote a Klingon-style kiss.[4]
Watch a performance of {HIchop!:sen:lyr} by Jen Usellis: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/v2bjc6U0tjI}

Esta palavra também pode denotar um beijo no estilo klingon.[4]
Assista a uma performance de {HIchop!:sen:lyr} de Jen Usellis: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/v2bjc6U0tjI}

This is almost a "chomp".
In the "Radio Times Star Trek 30th Anniversary Special Issue", the British expression "Give us a kiss, love." was translated as {HIchop, bang.:sen:nolink}[3]
▶ {lIchopbe'chugh ghewmey.:sen:nolink} "If the bugs do not bite you."[2] ▶ {'uSDaj chop, chev!:sen:nolink} "Bite his/her leg off!"[2]
▶ {lIchopbe'chugh ghewmey.:sen:nolink} "Если жуки не укусят тебя."[2] ▶ {'uSDaj chop, chev!:sen:nolink} "Откуси его/её ногу!"[2]
[1] {TKD:src}, [2] {PK:src}, [3] {Radio Times Star Trek 30th Anniversary Special Issue:src}, [4] {KLI mailing list 2020.04.21:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: آیا آن را نیش می زنید؟ [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This has a different meaning of "save" than {pol:v}, as in {nuqDaq yuch Dapol?:sen} "where do you keep the 'choc'olate?"

▶ {noH QapmeH wo' Qaw'lu'chugh yay chavbe'lu' 'ej wo' choqmeH may' DoHlu'chugh lujbe'lu'.:sen}[2] ▶ {wo' ngay' bochoqmeH bowIvlu'pu'!:sen:nolink} "You have been chosen to preserve the glory of the Empire!"[3].

▶ {noH QapmeH wo' Qaw'lu'chugh yay chavbe'lu' 'ej wo' choqmeH may' DoHlu'chugh lujbe'lu'.:sen}[2] ▶ {wo' ngay' bochoqmeH bowIvlu'pu'!:sen:nolink} "Вы все были выбраны, чтобы сохранить славу империи!"[3].

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {cha' vI' vagh choQmey lutoghlu':sen:nolink} "Number of Decks: 2.5"[1] ▶ {cha' choQmey naQ tu'lu' 'ej tep choQ bIngDaq lo' law' bID choQ tu'lu':sen:nolink} "2 Full Decks and a Half Utility Deck under the Cargo Deck"[1]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is used with the verb {mI':v}. It can be used both for the common exercise involving gripping a bar as well as for pulling oneself up to the top of a wall.[1]
This word is used whether the palms of the hands are facing towards or away from the exerciser. If a distinction must be made, the following terminology is used: {chap choQpel:n@@chap:n, choQpel:n} "pull-up" (overhand grip, palms face away), {toch choQpel:n@@toch:n, choQpel:n} "chin-up" (underhand grip, palms face exerciser).[1]
As an exercise, this may involve any number of repetitions with both arms. A variant called {baQpel:n} uses one arm for each movement in an alternating fashion.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word refers to the exterior midsection of the body. To refer to a stomach (an internal organ), use {burgh:n} instead.
Это слово относится к внешней секции тела. Чтобы упомянуть живот (внутренний орган), используйте {burgh:n} вместо этого.
This is defined in {TKD:src} as "belly".[1] The gloss "midsection" comes from {FTG:src}.[2]
▶ {tajwIj 'oHbe' chorlIj jeqbogh Dochvetlh'e'.:sen:nolink} "That is not my dagger protruding from your midsection."[2]
▶ {tajwIj 'oHbe' chorlIj jeqbogh Dochvetlh'e'.:sen:nolink} "Это не мой кинжал торчит из твоего живота."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: vaso de cerâmica com fundo plano
pot à fond plat en céramique
This is a {bargh:n} made of ceramic. This word can also be shortened to {chor:n:2,nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: eighth tone of nonatonic music scale
åttonde tonen på den nonatoniska skalan
oitavo tom da escala musical não-atônica
huitième note de la gamme musicale nonatonique
The tones of the Klingon musical scale (see {yutlhegh:n}) are: {yu:n}, {bIm:n}, {'egh:n}, {loS:n:2}, {vagh:n:2}, {jav:n:2}, {Soch:n:2}, {chorgh:n:2,nolink}, {yu:n:nolink}.
Die Töne der klingonischen Tonleiter (siehe {yutlhegh:n}) sind: {yu:n:nolink}, {bIm:n}, {'egh:n}, {loS:n:2}, {vagh:n:2}, {jav:n:2}, {Soch:n:2}, {chorgh:n:2}, {yu:n:nolink}.
Les tons de la gamme musicale klingonne (voir {yutlhegh:n}) sont: {yu:n:nolink}, {bIm:n}, {'egh:n}, {loS:n:2}, {vagh:n:2}, {jav:n:2}, {Soch:n:2}, {chorgh:n:2}, {yu:n:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: ser brilhante, ser polido, ser lustroso, ser liso
This means to have a smooth, silk-like, reflective surface.
Dies bedeutet eine glatte, seidenartige, reflektierende Oberfläche haben.
Innebär att ha en slät, silkesliknande, reflekterande yta.

The lyrics to "Alice's Restaurant Massacree" has several repetitions of the phrase "twenty seven eight-by-ten color glossy pictures". Glossy paper used in professional photos are often 8" ({chorgh:n:1}) by 10".

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: Note that there are two twilights in a day ({jaj:n}), one in the morning and one in the evening.
Заметьте, что есть двое сумерек в дне ({jaj:n}), одни утром и одни вечером.
Päivässä ({jaj:n}) on kaksi hämärää: aamuhämärä ja iltahämärä.

This is defined in {TKD:src} as "twilight" only. However, in {TNK:src}, the Terran expression "Good evening" is translated into Klingon as {maj choS:excl:nolink} (see {maj:excl}), suggesting that this word can also mean "evening" to a Klingon, at least in context.

table.name: mem
table.column: Quartz is 7 ({Soch:n:1}) on the Mohs mineral scale of hardness.

table.name: mem
table.column: Maltz noted that {-mang:sen:nolink} is not a nominalizing suffix.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: خیره شدن، خیره شدن، مشاهده کردن [AUTOTRANSLATED]

This is used when the subject is looking at something intently, with a lot of focus. It can also be used (often without an object) to mean staring off into space, staring at nothing in particular, zoning out, staring in a way that's not particularly focused. Context clarifies which connotation is intended.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: To "give an example" could be {chovnatlh 'agh:sen@@chovnatlh:n, 'agh:v} or {chovnatlh 'ang:sen@@chovnatlh:n, 'ang:v}. For "for example", use the phrase {chovnatlh 'oH:sen@@chovnatlh:n, 'oH:n} (or {chovnatlh ghaH:sen@@chovnatlh:n, ghaH:n}) after the example. If the example is long, it can be preceded with {chovnatlh vI'agh:sen@@chovnatlh:n, vI-:v, 'agh:v} or a similar construction.[2]
This was defined as "specimen" in {TKD:src}. The "example" definition was added at {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2024:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This verb is used for smuggling people only, unlike {Doy:v} which is general. {Doy:v:nolink} can be applied to people, but there is a difference in connotation: it is disparaging, whereas {choy:v:nolink} would definitely be used if one was smuggling someone on one's side out of a territory for their protection. Either might be used for trafficking in people.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {juHqo'Daq vaS'a' tu'lu'. ngoch luchermeH 'ej wo' San luwuqmeH pa' ghom tlhIngan yejquv DevwI'pu'. DaH che' ghawran. yejquv DevwI' moj ghawran 'e' wuqta' cho' 'oDwI' Dapu'bogh janluq pIqarD HoD.:sen:nolink} "On the Homeworld, there is a great hall where the leaders of the Klingon High Council meet to determine policy and decide upon the fate of the Empire. Gowron currently presides, named leader of the High Council by Captain Jean-Luc Picard, who was acting as Arbiter of Succession."[1]

▶ {juHqo'Daq vaS'a' tu'lu'. ngoch luchermeH 'ej wo' San luwuqmeH pa' ghom tlhIngan yejquv DevwI'pu'. DaH che' ghawran. yejquv DevwI' moj ghawran 'e' wuqta' cho' 'oDwI' Dapu'bogh janluq pIqarD HoD.:sen:nolink} "В родном мире, есть великий зал, где лидеры Клингонского высшего совета встречаются, чтобы определить политику, задать курс и решить судьбу империи. Сейчас председательствует Гаурон, лидер Высшего совета, назначенный капитаном Жаном-Люком Пикардом, который был Арбитром посвящения."[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: For shaved ice or the kind of ice in a sno-cone or smoothie, {chuch:n:nolink} is usually sufficient. A solid block of ice or an ice cube would be {chuch ngogh:n}.[2]
Для строганного льда или вида льда в смузи, {chuch:n:nolink} обычно достаточно. Твердая глыба льда или ледяной куб будут звучать {chuch ngogh:n}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: solid block of ice, ice cube
بلوک جامد از یخ، مکعب یخ [AUTOTRANSLATED]
bloco sólido de gelo, cubo de gelo

table.name: mem
table.column: An equivalent way to say this is {'aplom chuch:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: people, kin, member of the same group or tribe or clan
Leute, Mitglieder einer Gruppe, eines Stamms, eines Clans
مردم، قوم، اعضای یک گروه یا قبیله یا قبیله [AUTOTRANSLATED]
människor, släktingar, medlemmar i samma grupp, stam eller klan
люди, родственники, члены одной группы, племени или клана [AUTOTRANSLATED]
人、親屬、同一群體或部落或氏族的成員 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
pessoas, parentes, membros do mesmo grupo ou tribo ou clã
peuple, membres de famille, membres du même groupe, tribu ou clan
This may have been a back-fit for a mispronunciation of {jup:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: throw (a spear) at, hurl (a spear) at
پرتاب کردن (یک ریش) در، پرتاب (یک ریش) در [AUTOTRANSLATED]
kasta (ett spjut) mot, slunga (ett spjut) mot

This verb can only be used if the projectile is or resembles a spear. The object of this verb is the intended target. The suffix {-chu':v:suff} is used with this verb to indicate that the target is actually hit. [1, p.64]

table.name: mem
table.column: explain clearly to, clarify for, specify for
توضیح به وضوح، برای روشن شدن، مشخص برای [AUTOTRANSLATED]
förklara noga för, förtydliga för, närmare ange för
объяснить четко, уточнить для, указать для [AUTOTRANSLATED]
selittää jollekulle, selventää jollekulle, täsmentää jollekulle
expliquer clairement à, clarifier pour, préciser pour
The object of this verb is the person who wants clarification.[2, p.149]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to demonstrating good judgment based on experience, not just intelligence or book-learning.
Dies bezieht sich auf ein gutes Urteilsvermögen, das auf Erfahrung basiert, nicht nur auf Intelligenz oder Bildung.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word was awarded to {Qov:n:name} as a Friend of Maltz, hence the Canadian spelling in the definition.

table.name: mem
table.column:
Cantonese Chinese for "charge ahead" (衝).
Confirmed to be transitive at {qep'a' 30 (2023):src}. The object is the thing which is accelerated.

table.name: mem
table.column: The word {ghu':n} can be used to refer to a proposal (a proposed situation); that is, one can {chup:v} a {ghu':n}.[2]
Das Wort {ghu':n} kann verwendet werden, um sich auf einen Vorschlag (eine vorgeschlagene Situation) zu beziehen; Das heißt, man kann eine {ghu':n} {chup:v}.[2]
Слово {ghu':n} может быть использовано, чтобы упомянуть предложение (предлагаемая ситуация); что что-то может {chup:v} быть {ghu':n}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: pitkä kantomatka, pitkä toimintasäde, pitkä etäisyys

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a telescope in space, like the Hubble.
Dies bezieht sich auf ein Teleskop im Weltraum wie das Hubble.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word refers to a class of people.[2]
Dieses Wort bezieht sich auf eine Klasse von Menschen.[2]

That this refers to a class of people (rather than a character trait) was confirmed at the Q & A session at {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2021:src}. This was already supported by the fact that the only TOS episode with both Klingons and dialogue referring to nobility is {TOS - Elaan of Troyius:src}, where it referred to a class of people. The words {Doy'yuS:n}, {'elaS:n}, {telun Hovtay':n}, and {Dom:n} likewise appear only in this episode.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is used for physical discomfort, such as with clothes, room temperature, etc. The subject is the being that feels uncomfortable.
Dies beschreibt das Unwohlfühlen einer Person in Bezug auf Kleidung oder Temperatur usw. Das Subjekt des Verbes ist das Wesen, das sich nicht wohlfühlt.
In German, virgin wool is called Schurwolle, and clothes made of it are very scratchy.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is used for physical comfort, such as with clothes, room temperature, etc. The subject is the being that feels comfortable.
Dies beschreibt das Gefühl einer Person in Bezug auf Kleidung oder Temperatur usw. Das Subjekt des Verbes ist das Wesen, das sich wohlfühlt.

table.name: mem
table.column: vara högljudd, vara stojande, vara bråkig

table.name: mem
table.column: According to the glossary of {A Burning House:src}, this is a rodent that mostly lives underground and makes an annoying noise. Its name literally means "one which is noisy".

table.name: mem
table.column:
This seems to be composed of {chuS:v} and {'ugh:v}.
In the {TNG:src} novel {Power Hungry:src}, this was described as a four-stringed instrument, pear-shaped, about two feet high, and played with a bow while it rests on the knee.

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: vara kvar, vara över, vara överbliven
rester (sens de "nourriture pas mangée", "matériel pas utilisé" etc.)

table.name: mem
table.column: This can be used for leftover food (see {Soj chuv:n}). However, the core of an apple, which isn't eaten, is {SuqSIv:n}.[1]
Kann man für Essensreste benutzen (siehe {Soj chuv:n}). Das abgegessene Kerngehäuse eines Apfels heißt jedoch {SuqSIv:n}.[1]
Tätä voi käyttää ruokajäämistä (ks. {Soj chuv:n}). Omenan syömäkelvottomasta siemenkodasta käytetään kuitenkin sanaa {SuqSIv:n}.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: monnaie (sens de "monnaie rendu quand on paye avec un billet")
This is just an application of {chuv:n:1} to money, and refers to the difference when a customer hands over a larger unit of money than the amount of the bill.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: The {chuvmey:n:nolink} include pronouns, numbers, conjunctions, adverbials, and exclamations.
Die {chuvmey:n:nolink} beinhalten Pronomen, Zahlen, Konjunktionen, Adverbien und Ausrufe.
{chuvmey:n:nolink} включает в себя местоимения, числительные, объединения, обстоятельства и восклицания.

table.name: mem
table.column:
"Achoo!"
The noun {chuyDaH:n} seems to imply that this verb, or a homophone, can be used to describe the expulsion of gas at a high velocity.

table.name: mem
table.column:
Types of thrusters include {'eDSeHcha:n}, {lolSeHcha:n}, {muDDaq 'eDSeHcha lulaQlu'bogh:n}, {Hong boq chuyDaH:n}, and {'o' chuyDaH:n}.
Watch Gowron say {chuyDaH yIlaQ!:sen:nolink}: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/KKZoYsbxUjY}
Schau dir an, wie Gowron {chuyDaH yIlaQ!:sen:nolink} sagt: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/KKZoYsbxUjY}

Типы ускорителей включают {'eDSeHcha:n}, {lolSeHcha:n}, {muDDaq 'eDSeHcha lulaQlu'bogh:n}, {Hong boq chuyDaH:n}, и {'o' chuyDaH:n}.
Смотрите, как Гаурон говорит это {chuyDaH yIlaQ!:sen:nolink}: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/KKZoYsbxUjY}
Regarde comment Gowron dit {chuyDaH yIlaQ!:sen:nolink}: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/KKZoYsbxUjY}
{DaH:n} appears to be "array", and {chuy:v:nolink} may be related to the verb "to sneeze".

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: slå av, stänga av, avaktivera (en enhet)
This word is not defined as such in canon, but appears in the bodies of {TKD:src} and {KGT:src}[1; 2]. This entry is here for ease of reference only.

table.name: mem
table.column: The glossary to {A Burning House:src} claims that {chu'wI':n:nolink} meaning "trigger" is also slang for "rookie", "beginner", or "newbie". See {chu':v:1}.
